title: Engaging eco-NFTs for the Planet
description: Bitcoin and ethereum's proof of work ecosystem has done huge damage to the environment due to the computations required for mining.

f6_assessments.q0: the problem statement points towards reversing the carbon emmission issue and damage caused by large scale crypto mining to environment and this is problem in physical world to be resolved in physical medium and not buy gamified virtual medium which definitely create awareness but not address the problem statement. The charity mentioned points to the cause but not being the main purpose of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The team as mentioned on the proposal definitely has good software development and marketing capability, but on the other hand,a proper plan for approaching public about the charity which addresses the problem statement isn't aligned.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is sufficient to audit only the completion of the software product being the game but doesn't give insight how to track the actual reversal of the POW damage impact, which being the key problem statement chosen.

f6_assessments.q0: I like the idea but I would like to see the problem statement and solution clarified, at the moment the problem statement and the solution is disconnected - the problem statement talks about the proof of work environmental damage, but the solution does not address the problem statement in a clear manner. Gamefying NFTs to raise funds for conservation will add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The use of NFTs for conservation is a good idea. However, the project requires further elaboration. I would like to see links to LinkedIn or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about the team work history, education and past experiences. The team can expand on the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed".
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided a roadmap with milestones for the next 12 months. I would like to see the team develop and define Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project – what does success look like in 6 to 9month, how many customers do you target  – set a goal and use it as a KPI, then connect the KPI to your milestones on the roadmap. Lastly, I would like to see the budget developed beyond a single line entry with a percentage breakdown for items, the team can create a detailed breakdown by connecting the budget to the roadmap with KPI's. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project will be difficult to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge has a strong focus on NFT Business Models, however these proposers don't really describe a business model. This idea is about engaging people for eco-friendly initiatives (which of course is good). However, this only slightly affects the goal of the challenge. As there is more an idea than a plan presented (see feasaiblity), the impact on Cardano remains unclear as well. Overall, the idea has good beginnings, but it does not yet sound mature.
f6_assessments.q1: Overall, the proposal is a description of an idea (which has its value) that says roughly what is to be done, what the first steps are, but does not indicate how they will be carried out. How will the 2D game be created? How will you direct community funds to projects (and how do you even get the community funds)? These are just some of the questions that came up. Also the details for the technical implementation are completely missing. The budget is also only roughly linked to the presented plan. What are the marketing expenses for? Furthermore, the proposers do not provide any links or references and the proof-of-life is also missing. Based on the given information, I cannot see a successful implementation yet.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap is presented that shows which tasks are to be completed and in what time frame. However, no metrics or definition of success are presented. Also, no source is given to document the progress of the project. Therefore, I do not see how the project can be audited. For a better evaluation in the next round I recommend to implement the mentioned points in all criteria.

solution: Leveraging NFTs and gamifying it as well as cooperating with real world environmental projects to reverse much of the damages done
